method.summary: Get results for a query against the database.
method.description: This service provides full access to arbitrary database queries. Queries are accepted in a serialised XML format, executed and returned in a streaming manner. The query format is a custom subset of the capabilities of SQL; see the InterMine wiki for a full description of the query XML syntax.

param.description: A definition of the query to execute in Path-Query XML format
The version of the XML format used
The index of the first result to return.
The maximum size of the result set.

method.summary: Save the result set of a query as a list on the server.
method.description: This service provides the facility to submit a query and create a new list whose contents shall be the result set defined by running the query. This facility places a couple of restrictions on the query itself, namely that the view list may only contain a single item, which should refer to the internal id attribute of an object in the query.

param.description: A definition of the query to execute in Path-Query XML format
The name for the new list. There must be no existing list of this name
A description to attach to the new list
A set of tags to use to categorise the new list

method.summary: Add the result set of a query to a list on the server.
method.description: This service provides the facility to submit a query and add the objects contained in its result set to a list that already exists on the server. This facility places a couple of restrictions on the query itself, namely that the view list may only contain a single item, which should refer to the internal id attribute of an object in the query.

param.description: A definition of the query to execute in Path-Query XML format.
The list to append items to.
A set of tags to use to categorise the new list

method.summary: Save queries to a user account on the server.
method.description: This service provides the facility to submit one or more queries and save it/them for future reference to a user account on the server.

param.description: A definition of the query/ies to save in Path-Query XML format.
The version of the path-qeury format being used.

method.summary: Find lists on the server containing an object.
method.description: This service allows users to get back a list of lists that contain a given object, either defined by an internal ID, or looked up from stable identifiers. If the request does not authenticate to a user account, then only relevant public lists will be returned.

param.description: A stable identifier that can be used to find the object.
The internal DB id (changes on each re-release).
The type of object (required if using a public id)
An extra value to disambiguate objects

method.summary: Add items to an existing list by identifiers
method.description: This service allows users to add new items to an existing list by uploading a set of identifiers. This is equivalent to creating a new list from a set of identifiers, and then performing the union operation on that list an existing one, if the resulant list replaced the existing list.

param.description: The name of the list to append to

body.description: Identifiers for objects to add to the list, tab, comma or newline separated.

method.name: Combine Lists
method.summary: Combine Two or More Lists through Union
method.description: This service allows users to create new lists which contain all the members contained in the set of input lists. The user must have access to all the input lists, but need not be the owner of any of them. A union of a single list with itself may be considered a copy.

param.description: The name of the list to create
The name of a source list
A description of this new list
A set of tags to apply to the new list

method.summary: Subtract one List From Another
method.description: This service allows users to create new lists which contain only those elements which are present in one set of lists, and none of those elements which are present in another set of lists. This is what is typically thought of as subtraction, or more technically, the asymmetric difference of two sets. The user must supply the names of the lists to be used as either the source lists or the subtraction lists, as well as details for the new list to be created. The user must have access to all the named lists, but need not be the owner of any of them.

param.description: The name of the list to create
The name of a source list
The name of a list to exclude
A description of this new list
A set of tags to apply to the new list

method.name: Intersect Lists
method.summary: Combine Two or More Lists through Intersection
method.description: This service allows users to create new lists which contain only those items which are members of all the source lists. The user must have access to all the input lists, but need not be the owner of any of them. An intersection of a single list may be considered a copy.

param.description: The name of the list to create
The name of a source list, or multiple list names concatenated with a ';' separator.
A description of this new list
A set of tags to apply to the new list

method.name: Symmetric Difference
method.summary: Combine Two or More Lists through Difference
method.description: This service allows users to create new lists which only contain members which are not shared by an even number of lists (see: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Symmetric_difference). The user must have access to all the input lists, but need not be the owner of any of them.

param.description: The name of the list to create
The name of a source list
A description of this new list
A set of tags to apply to the new list

method.summary: Find lists on the server.
method.description: This service allows users to get back a list of lists that they have access to. The lists can be optionally be filtered on the server by name, thus returning just a single name, or if '*' wildcards are used, a subset of all lists.

param.description: An optional filter by name.

method.summary: Create a new list
method.description: This service allows users to add new items to an existing list by uploading a set of identifiers. This is equivalent to creating a new list from a set of identifiers, and then performing the union operation on that list an existing one, if the resulant list replaced the existing list.

param.description: The name of the new list
The type of the list
A disambiguating value (such as organism name)

body.description: Identifiers for objects to add to the list, tab, comma or newline separated.

method.summary: Rename an Existing List
method.description: This service allows users to change the name of an existing list that they are the owner of.

method.summary: Save a Template, or Overwrite an Existing One
method.description: This service allows users to save templates they have authored on the server, associated with their account. The templates once saved can be used as any other template query.

param.description: One or more templates, serialised in XML format.
The version of the XML format

method.summary: Get the results from running a template with a given set of parameters
method.description: Templates are predefined parameterised queries which may be run by supplying values and operators for the available editable constraints. To run a template, for example which has the following editable constraints: <constraint path="Gene.symbol" op="=" value="eve" editable="true"> <constraint path="Gene.length" op=">" value="1000" editable="true"> Then the user should supply the following parameters to run it with the default values: constraint1=Gene.symbol&op1=eq&value1=eve&constraint2=Gene.length&op2=gt&value2=1000 The value of the number used to identify each constraint is ignored - it must however be consistent for each parameter.

param.description: The name of the template to run
One of a variable set of parameters used to supply constraint values
The index of the first result to return.
The maximum size of the result set.

method.summary: Create a List from the Output of a Template
method.description: This service allows the user to create a list from the result set of running a template with a given set of parameters. The parameters for running the template are the same as when requesting results, and in addition to these parameters the user needs to supply a name and optional description for the list to be created. To define which part of the template results, the user must supply a path parameter which indicates a valid column from the output to be used. Templates are predefined parameterised queries which may be run by supplying values and operators for the available editable constraints. To run a template, for example which has the following editable constraints: <constraint path="Gene.symbol" op="=" value="eve" editable="true"> <constraint path="Gene.length" op=">" value="1000" editable="true"> Then the user should supply the following parameters to run it with the default values: constraint1=Gene.symbol&op1=eq&value1=eve&constraint2=Gene.length&op2=gt&value2=1000 The value of the number used to identify each constraint is ignored - it must however be consistent for each parameter.

param.description: The name of the template to run
The path to use to compose the results
One of a variable set of parameters used to supply constraint values
The name for the new list. There must be no existing list of this name
A description to attach to the new list
A set of tags to use to categorise the new list

metadata.name: Append to List from Template Results

method.summary: Add items to a list from a set of results from running a template
method.description: This service allows the user to add items to a list from the result set of running a template with a given set of parameters. The parameters for running the template are the same as when requesting results, and in addition to these parameters the user needs to supply a name and optional description for the list to be created. To define which part of the template results, the user must supply a path parameter which indicates a valid column from the output to be used. Templates are predefined parameterised queries which may be run by supplying values and operators for the available editable constraints. To run a template, for example which has the following editable constraints: <constraint path="Gene.symbol" op="=" value="eve" editable="true"> <constraint path="Gene.length" op=">" value="1000" editable="true"> Then the user should supply the following parameters to run it with the default values: constraint1=Gene.symbol&op1=eq&value1=eve&constraint2=Gene.length&op2=gt&value2=1000 The value of the number used to identify each constraint is ignored - it must however be consistent for each parameter.

param.description: The name of the template to run
The path to use to compose the results
One of a variable set of parameters used to supply constraint values
The name of the list to add items to.

method.summary: Get the list of available templates.
method.description: Get a listing of the templates configured in an InterMine instance. Each template contains a description of its properties, defining the parameters that must be provided to run it, as well as a definition of the output format for its results. If the request is authenticated to a user, then the templates that that has access to will also be returned.

param.description: Whether or not to include invalid templates. Invalid templates cannot be run.

method.summary: Get a description of the data model
method.description: An InterMine data model can be fully described as a set of classes with various properties. This data model is useful for constructing queries and interpreting the results returned from the service.

method.summary: Get the Web-Service Version.
method.description: Get the web-service version number. This number is incremented for each change in functionality.

method.summary: Get the Data-Warehouse Release Version.
method.description: Get the release version of the data-warehouse. This is a string that is changed each time data is added or removed from the server. Thus this number is meant to reflect the contents rather than the interface of this set of services.

method.summary: Get the possible values a path may have.

method.summary: Get details about the authenticated user
method.description: Retrieve information about the currently authenticated user. This can be used to display the user's name.

method.summary: Get a new API key
method.description: This service allows a user to retrieve an API token which is valid for up to 24 hours of unlimited use. The primary use case is to get an API key where the user has only username/password credentials, since the use of API keys is more secure.

method.name: User Creation
method.summary: Create a new user in the user-profile
method.description: This service allows users of the web service to create a new user account. A user account is required for a number of operations, such as saving lists. This service allows users of the webservice to register an account, and start using these features that require authentication. The username and password provided will be able to be used for future requests, as will an API key provided with the response, which is valid for 24 hours. This is equivalent to the registration mechanism in the web-application interface. Requests to this service are rate limited by IP Address

param.description: The user name of the new user. It should be an email address if possible. There must not be any user with the same username
A password to associate with the account.
Whether or not to subscribe to the mine's mailing list, if it has one. The username must be an email address if true

method.name: Share a List
method.summary: Authorise another user to access a list
method.description:
This service provides a means for authorising another user to access a list. To share a list the user making the request must be the owner of the list and you must know the username of the user you wish to share with. If you do not know the username of the user to share with, then the user should issue an invitation instead. The user the list is shared with must exist and the list must not already be shared with them.
The service returns information detailing whom the list in question is currently shared with.

param.description: The list of yours you wish to share.
The username of the user who will have access.
Whether or not to send an email to the user you are sharing with.

method.name: Details of Currently Shared Lists
method.summary: Retrieve information about which lists are shared with and by whom.
method.description: Get information about each list that is shared by or with the authenticating user. The service returns a map with two keys "sharedByUser" and "sharedWithUser" which are themselves each maps, with list names as keys, and either lists of users with access as values, or the name of the original owner as values.

method.name: Stop Sharing a List
method.summary: Rescind the Permission Granted to a User to Access a List.
method.description:
Stop a user from being able to access a list that you own. This service allows a user to remove a user's previously granted permission to view the contents of a list.
Other than a json results envelope no meaningful results are returned, and the caller should simply check for a successful response.
